intro: Hyptis obtecta, commonly known as silverleaf hyptis, is a perennial herb native to the tropical regions of the Americas. It belongs to the mint family (Lamiaceae) and is characterized by its silver-gray, hairy foliage. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and has opposite, ovate to lanceolate leaves. Its small, tubular flowers are usually pink or purple and are clustered in whorls along the stems. Hyptis obtecta is often used in traditional medicine for its purported anti-inflammatory and analgesic properties.
